title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, readjustment counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members. During the three-year period after a veteran's return from deployment in Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, the program provides education, support, counseling, and mental health services to assist the veteran and their immediate family with readjustment to civilian life, recovery from injuries or illnesses, and family readjustment. The program provides mental health services to veterans returning from deployment in Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary contracts with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services in areas not adequately served by VA facilities. Contracts require employing veterans trained under subsection (c) and using telehealth services. The program requires providers to use telehealth services for delivering services, participate in training programs, comply with VA protocols, and submit annual reports to the Secretary. The program requires providers to submit annual reports to the Secretary, including the number of veterans served, diagnosed, and treated, along with demographic information. Providers must also provide clinical summary information to the Department of Veterans Affairs for each veteran receiving mental health services. The Secretary requires providers to submit annual reports with clinical summary information for veterans receiving mental health services. Additionally, the Secretary mandates meeting specific requirements and contracting with a national organization for training veterans to provide peer-outreach and peer-support services. The Secretary conducts a training program for clinicians at community mental health centers to ensure they can provide services to veterans from Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. Reports are required. The Secretary must submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation and status of the program within specific timeframes. The Secretary must submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation of the program, including information on the number of veterans receiving services and an evaluation of service provision. The Secretary must submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation of the program, including an evaluation of service provision, extension of the period, national mental health organizations providing services, and training evaluation.
